fields.name: filter
fields.description:
Delete documents which matching specified filter.
A filter can simply be key, value where key
is the field name and value would be the value for this field. Or a filter can be logical where
two or more fields can be logically joined using $or and $and. A few examples of filter:
<li> To delete a user document where the id has a value 1: ```{"id": 1 }```
<li> To delete all the user documents where the key "id" has a value 1 or 2 or 3: `{"$or": [{"id": 1}, {"id": 2}, {"id": 3}]}`

fields.name: db
fields.description: Database name to read documents from.

fields.name: collection
fields.description: Collection name to read documents from.

fields.name: filter
fields.description:
Returns documents matching this filter. A filter can simply be a key, value pair where a key is the field name and the value would be the value for this field. Tigris also allows complex filtering by passing logical expressions. Logical filters are applied on two or more fields using `$or` and `$and`. A few examples of filters:
  • To read a user document where the id has a value 1: ```{"id": 1 }```
  • To read all the user documents where the key "id" has a value 1 or 2 or 3: `{"$or": [{"id": 1}, {"id": 2}, {"id": 3}]}` Filter allows setting collation on an individual field level. To set collation for all the fields see options. The detailed documentation of the filter is here.

fields.name: fields
fields.description: To read specific fields from a document. Default is all.

fields.name: options
fields.description:
Options that can be used to modify the results, for example `limit` to control the number of documents
returned by the server.

messages.name: ReadRequestOptions
messages.description:
Options that can be used to modify the results, for example "limit" to control the number of documents
returned by the server.

fields.name: limit
fields.description: Limit the number of documents returned by the read operation.

fields.name: skip
fields.description: Number of documents to skip before starting to return resulting documents.

fields.name: offset
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination. The next streams will return documents after this offset.

fields.name: collation
fields.description:
A collation allows you to specify string comparison rules. Default is case-sensitive, to override it you can set
this option to 'ci' that will apply to all the text fields in the filters.

fields.name: data
fields.description: Object containing the collection document.

fields.name: resume_token
fields.description: An internal key, used for pagination.

fields.description: Has metadata related to the documents stored.

messages.description: Contains metadata related to the search hit, has information about document created_at/updated_at as well.

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: Time at which the document was inserted/replaced. Measured in nano-seconds since the Unix epoch.

fields.name: updated_at

fields.description: Total number of search results across all pages

fields.name: collection

fields.description: Query string for searching across text fields

fields.name: search_fields
fields.description: Array of fields to project search query against
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: filter
fields.description: Filter stacks on top of query results to further narrow down the results. Similar to `ReadRequest.filter`

fields.name: facet
fields.description:
Facet query to aggregate results on given fields. The field name for the facet search can be passed like this `{"brand": { "size": 10 }}`
where the size controls the total facets for this field.

fields.name: sort
fields.description: Array of fields and corresponding sort orders to order the results `[{ "salary": "$desc" }]`

fields.name: include_fields
fields.description: Array of document field names to include in results. By default, all fields are included.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: exclude_fields
fields.description: Array of document field names to exclude from results. `include_fields`, if specified, takes precedence over `exclude_fields`.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: page_size
fields.description: Optionally can set the number of hits to be returned per page, default is 20.

fields.name: page
fields.description: Optionally can specify the page to retrieve. If page is set then only hits for this page is returned

fields.name: collation
fields.description:
A collation allows you to specify string comparison rules. Default is case-sensitive, to override it you can set
this option to 'ci' that will apply to all the text fields in the filters.

messages.name: TransactionCtx
messages.description:
Contains ID which uniquely identifies transaction
This context is returned by BeginTransaction request and
should be passed in the metadata (headers) of subsequent requests
in order to run them in the context of the same transaction.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique for a single transactional request.

fields.name: origin
fields.description: Serves as an internal identifier.

messages.name: TransactionOptions
messages.description: Options that can be used to modify the transaction semantics.

fields.name: db
fields.description: Database name where to update documents

fields.name: collection
fields.description: Collection name where to update documents

fields.name: fields
fields.description:
Fields contains set of fields
with the values which need to be updated.
Should be proper JSON object.

fields.name: filter
fields.description:
Update documents which matching specified filter.
A filter can simply be key, value where key
is the field name and value would be the value for this field. Or a filter can be logical where
two or more fields can be logically joined using $or and $and. A few examples of filter:
<li> To update a user document where the id has a value 1: ```{"id": 1 }```
<li> To update all the user documents where the key "id" has a value 1 or 2 or 3: `{"$or": [{"id": 1}, {"id": 2}, {"id": 3}]}`

messages.name: UpdateRequestOptions
messages.description: Additional options for update requests.

fields.name: collation
fields.description:
A collation allows you to specify string comparison rules. Default is case-sensitive, to override it you can set
this option to 'ci' that will apply to all the text fields in the filters.

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: Has metadata related to the documents stored.

fields.name: modified_count
fields.description: Returns the number of documents modified.

fields.name: status
fields.description: an enum with value set as "updated".

messages.name: WriteOptions
messages.description: Additional options to modify write requests.

methods.name: BeginTransaction
methods.description:
Starts a new transaction and returns a transactional object. All reads/writes performed
within a transaction will run with serializable isolation.

methods.name: CommitTransaction
methods.description:
Atomically commit all the changes performed in the context of the transaction. Commit provides all
or nothing semantics by ensuring no partial updates are in the database due to a transaction failure.

methods.name: RollbackTransaction
methods.description:
Rollback transaction discards all the changes
performed in the transaction

methods.name: Insert
methods.description:
Inserts new documents in the collection and returns an AlreadyExists error if any of the documents
in the request already exists. Insert provides idempotency by returning an error if the document
already exists. To replace documents, use REPLACE API instead of INSERT.

methods.name: Replace
methods.description: Inserts the documents or replaces the existing documents in the collections.

methods.name: Delete
methods.description: Delete a range of documents in the collection using the condition provided in the filter.

methods.name: Update
methods.description: Update a range of documents in the collection using the condition provided in the filter.

methods.name: Read
methods.description: Reads a range of documents from the collection, or messages from a collection in case of event streaming. Tigris does not require you to index any fields and automatically index all the fields which means you can filter by any field in the document. An empty filter will trigger reading all the documents inside this collection. The API supports pagination that can be used by passing `Limit/Skip` parameters. The `skip` parameter skips the number of documents from the start and the `limit` parameter is used to specify the number of documents to read. You can find more detailed documentation of the Read API here.

methods.name: Search
methods.description: Searches a collection for the documents matching the query, or messages in case of event streaming. A search can be a term search or a phrase search. Search API allows filtering the result set using filters as documented here. You can also perform a faceted search by passing the fields in the facet parameter. You can find more detailed documentation of the Search API with multiple examples here.

methods.name: CreateOrUpdateCollection
methods.description:
Creates a new collection or atomically upgrades the collection to the new schema provided in the request. Schema changes are applied atomically and immediately without any downtime. Tigris Offers two types of collections:

  • `DOCUMENTS`: Offers rich CRUD APIs.
  • `MESSAGES`: Offers event streaming APIs.

methods.name: DropCollection
methods.description: Drop the collection inside this database. This API deletes all of the documents inside this collection and any metadata associated with it.

methods.name: ListDatabases
methods.description: List returns all the databases.

methods.name: ListCollections
methods.description: List all the collections present in the database passed in the request.

methods.name: CreateDatabase
methods.description: Creates a new database. Returns an AlreadyExists error with a status code 409 if the database already exists.

methods.name: DropDatabase
methods.description: Drop database deletes all the collections in this database along with all of the documents, and associated metadata for these collections.

methods.name: DescribeDatabase
methods.description:
This API returns information related to the database along with all the collections inside the database.
This can be used to retrieve the size of the database or to retrieve schemas and the size of all the collections present in this database.

methods.name: DescribeCollection
methods.description: Returns the information related to the collection. This can be used to retrieve the schema or size of the collection.

methods.name: Events
methods.description:
Stream real-time events for mutations made to the collections in the database. Each stream will have a transaction
identifier attached to it and will have a boolean flag last set to the last event of the transaction which will be useful
if a transaction performed more than one operation in the collection.

methods.name: Publish
methods.description: Endpoint for publishing messages to a topic.

methods.name: Subscribe
methods.description:
Endpoint for subscribing to a topic to receive a stream of messages. The `partition` can be set to stream only
from a specific partition.

methods.name: Health
methods.description: This endpoint can be used to check the liveness of the server.

messages.name: GetAccessTokenRequest
messages.description:
The Request message for the GetAccessToken. The grant type is a required field and based on the grant type
the other fields are used as mentioned below.

fields.name: refresh_token
fields.description: Refresh token is required when grant type is set as `REFRESH_TOKEN`.

fields.name: client_id
fields.description: Client Id is required when grant type is set as `CLIENT_CREDENTIALS`.

fields.name: client_secret
fields.description: Your Tigris API Key is required when grant type is set as `CLIENT_CREDENTIALS`.

messages.name: GetAccessTokenResponse
messages.description: The response of GetAccessToken which contains access_token and optionally refresh_token.

fields.name: access_token
fields.description: An Access Token.

fields.name: refresh_token
fields.description: The Refresh Token.

fields.name: expires_in
fields.description: Access token expiration timeout in seconds.

methods.name: GetAccessToken
methods.description: Endpoint for receiving access token from Tigris Server. The endpoint requires Grant Type(`grant_type`) which has two possible values "REFRESH_TOKEN" or "CLIENT_CREDENTIALS" based on which either Refresh token(`refresh_token`) needs to be set or client credentials(`client_id`, `client_secret`).

enums.name: Code
enums.description: Codes returned by the Tigris server in the case of error

enums.name: MetricQueryFunction
enums.description: Function to apply on metrics query

enums.name: MetricQuerySpaceAggregation
enums.description: Specifies how the metric should be aggregated for the time slices.

enums.name: RollupAggregator
enums.description:
Specifies how the initial query's result buckets should be processed in
next stage.

messages.name: AdditionalFunction
messages.description: Additional function to apply on metrics query

messages.name: DataPoint
messages.description: Represents the data point in timeseries.

messages.name: Error
messages.description: The Error type defines a logical error model

fields.name: code
fields.description:
The status code is a short, machine parsable string,
which uniquely identifies the error type.
Tigris to HTTP code mapping [here](/reference/http-code)

fields.name: message
fields.description: A developer-facing descriptive error message

messages.name: ErrorDetails
messages.description: ErrorDetails defines error format passed by Tigris HTTP protocol

fields.name: error
fields.description: NOTE: This is a hack to propagate this object definition to OpenAPI

messages.name: MetricSeries
messages.description: Represents series in timeseries based on input query.

messages.name: QueryTimeSeriesMetricsRequest
messages.description: Requests the time series metrics

messages.name: QueryTimeSeriesMetricsResponse
messages.description: QueryTimeSeriesMetric responds with this type.

messages.name: RetryInfo
messages.description: Contains retry information

fields.name: delay
fields.description: retry delay advice in milliseconds

messages.name: RollupFunction
messages.description:
Rollup function aggregates the slices of metrics returned by original query
and lets you operate on the slices using aggregator and constructs the
bigger slice of your choice of interval (specified in seconds).

methods.name: QueryTimeSeriesMetrics
methods.description: Queries time series metrics

methods.name: GetInfo
methods.description: Provides the information about the server. This information includes returning the server version, etc.

scalarValueTypes.notes: Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers  if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint32 instead.
Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers  if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint64 instead.
Uses variable-length encoding. Signed int value. These more efficiently encode negative numbers than regular int32s.
Uses variable-length encoding. Signed int value. These more efficiently encode negative numbers than regular int64s.
Always four bytes. More efficient than uint32 if values are often greater than 2^28.
Always eight bytes. More efficient than uint64 if values are often greater than 2^56.
A string must always contain UTF-8 encoded or 7-bit ASCII text.
May contain any arbitrary sequence of bytes.
